answers.answer: First, the obvious. You need to lose weight, stop smoking and get active if your doctor says it's OK. Also, you ARE hypertensive, in fact you are at stage 2 hypertension when you get over 160/100 so you definately have some issues.The tingling is not really a symptom of high BP, but can ge a result of it. For instance, HBP can affect your kidneys and cause diabetes which could cause the tingling you are experiencing. HBP has an affect on so many systems in your body that it may well be the trigger of an underlying conditon. What did your doctor say and has he prescribed anything to lower your BP?Let us know.Jon

question: Greetings,I am a 29 years old male, being around 80lbs overwiehgt ( i know i know), having a sedentary lifestyle, i smoke one pack of cigaretees a day, i drink alcholol and coffee moderately, my salt intake is somehow moderate as well.I am having since one month weird symptoms, like headache, dizziness and some tingling sensations and my arms and legs. I went to a doctor and i made a ecg test, the results came out strictly normal, however my cholesterol and trygl. levels are high and my blood pressure is ranging from 140/90 to 165/100.He told me to change my lifestyle, however i am sill having the tingling sensations today especially when i walk...Is it normal since i am not hypertensive or it is a sign of a heart attack?Thank you.
title: Hypertension symptoms
